contentencoded: China is feeling a credit crunch, after China’s central bank froze lending between China's financial institutions this week. Marketplace China Bureau Chief Rob Schmitz joins Morning Report host Mark Garrison to explain what's behind the policy move and what it means for markets outside China.
title: Why China's credit crunch is our problem
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Friday, June 21, 2013
description: China is feeling a credit crunch, after China’s central bank froze lending between China's financial institutions this week.
teaser: China is feeling a credit crunch, after China’s central bank froze lending between China's financial institutions this week.
